qas.question: Athanasius began his leading role at what age?
In what year was the First Council of Nicaea?
Athanasius was also known as what?
How many years after the First Council of Nicaea did Athanasius become archbishop?
Who is one emporer Athanasius struggled against?
Why was the First Council of Nicaea convened?

answers.text: Jesus of Nazareth, is of a distinct substance from the Father

qas.question: Because of his conflicts with the emperors, how was he known?
Whose position was it that Jesus was the Son of God?
What year did Athanasius become a Roman emperor?
What year did Constantine meet Athanasius?
How old was Constantine when he was crowned emperor?
In what year did the First Council of Nicaea end?
How many years did the First Council of Nicaea last?
Athanasius ended his leading role at what age?
In what year was the last Council of Nicaea?
Athanasius was never known as what?
How many years after the First Council of Nicaea did Athanasius become pope?
What peaceful protest shaped his career?

context: <a5_0><b18_0>Conflict with Arius and Arianism<b18_0/><a5_0/> as well as successive Roman emperors shaped Athanasius's career. In <a1_0><b9_0><b10_0><b15_0>325<b15_0/><b10_0/><b9_0/><a1_0/>, at the age of <a0_0><b11_0><b14_0>27<b14_0/><b11_0/><a0_0/>, Athanasius began his leading role against the Arians as his bishop's assistant during the First Council of Nicaea. Roman emperor Constantine the Great had convened the council in May–August <b12_0>325<b12_0/> to address <a8_0>the Arian position<a8_0/> that the Son of God, <a6_0>Jesus of Nazareth, is of a distinct substance from the Father<a6_0/>. <a3_0><b13_0><b17_0>Three years<b17_0/><b13_0/><a3_0/> after that council, Athanasius succeeded his mentor as archbishop of Alexandria. In addition to the conflict with the Arians (including powerful and influential Arian churchmen led by Eusebius of Nicomedia), he struggled against the Emperors <a4_0>Constantine<a4_0/>, Constantius II, Julian the Apostate and Valens. He was known as "<a2_0><b16_0>Athanasius Contra Mundum<b16_0/><a2_0/>" (Latin for <a7_0>Athanasius Against the World<a7_0/>).
